text: the hexan hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of the new hacks and cloak LP
excavation this is the sophomore
full-length LP from this uk-based
musical project its self-titled
full-length album came out in 2011 this
new record is out now on triangle
records a label that specializes in the
dark the moody the atmospheric through
artists like Balam akka as well as clams
casino avian Christ even vessel whose
last full-length LP I reviewed pretty
recently and the label is kind of picky
only choosing a handful of different
artists for its roster and all of them
sort of bringing their own unique brand
or flair to these moods these vibes that
the label sort of specializes in and
certainly the haxon cloak has no
problems meeting these needs on this new
full-length album just look at the title
if this album is an excavation certainly
the accent cloak gets very low it gets
subterranean I haven't heard electronic
music or at least electronically tinged
music this frightening since some of
lust mort's best albums I also would not
be surprised if the Hexen cloak took a
lot of influence from horror movie
soundtracks on this LP and I don't just
mean the music that may be composed for
a horror movie soundtrack I'm talking
about like the gargantuan bass hits and
the very sharp jump out in your face
noises that appear in about every modern
horror movie trailer this is essentially
the opening track of this album in a
nutshell like I said earlier this album
is essentially dark ambient music it
lasts for about an hour stretched across
nine tracks a lot of the tracks on this
LP are incredibly vast and tall and wide
thanks to the incredible reverb that the
accent cloak employs on this album but
many of the songs are beat driven as
well which does give these tracks pace
does give them direction a lot of the
tracks on this LP though don't really
rise in a way that is traditionally
exciting in music the accent cloak kind
of prefers to hang down in the deep
bassy murk of low end frequencies this
album is so dark at times you can even
see your end
front of your face which is also a
description I threw at the vessel album
that I also reviewed on triangle records
but the Hexen cloak is much more
obsessed with low frequencies than high
creating rumbles creating fuzz a
physical experience with the music that
feeling definitely comes through on
parts one and two of the title track on
this LP the first of which features all
these sputtering clicking very busy
electronics matched up against some very
eerie and bacey atmosphere tones the
second part of this title track has all
these kind of metallic waves of sound
repeating and just cycling over and over
and over it's like an industrial
anaconda and the song eventually gives
away to some very beautiful synthesizer
arpeggios the accent cloaks sort of
tossing very sparse moments of beauty at
the listener matched up with just this
grimness the horror movie sound play
gets intensified on the next two tracks
of the selkies starting with Mara these
massive drum hits and I mean massive are
pulsating throughout the track huge
piano hits on the song as well from the
low end of the pitch spectrum and these
wailing strings coming like the strings
creep like drips of blood coming down
the wall of the horrible torture chamber
that all these sounds are clearly coming
from the song leaps right into the track
mist which starts off with a voice that
literally jumps out at the listener like
a knife-wielding psycho the song has
this dragging double bass line it sounds
like a horrible fog lurching out from
some kind of creepy forest and the way
the vocal that popped up right at the
start of this track is edited and placed
throughout the song in this sort of
skippy strange way it's kind of creative
odd and very memorable there is more
appeal to this LP though than being
completely creeped out though being
creeped out will be the most obvious
reaction to have when listening to this
but let me say this if the sounds on
this album weren't crafted amazingly
well and if the songs weren't sort of
built and pasted in a way that kept them
engaging and interesting these creepy
feelings wouldn't necessarily even come
about in the first place it's the very
last song on this album
it feels kind of like a legitimate
change of pace this synth melody comes
through that is actually pretty serene
and in comparison to a lot of the other
stuff on this LP is kind of obliphica
the song grows very dark and very cold
over a slow period of time though the
song is 12 freakin minutes long but as
it gets darker and heavier with some
very eerie strings and some double bass
and a very heavy heavy bass drum the
slow very basic and over the course of
the song boring beat actually where's
the songs welcome out really fast the
song slowly decays into staleness over
its 12-minute run time unfortunately the
most obvious downsides to this LP is
that there are some moments that drag on
and don't have an incredible amount of
musical detail or just sonic detail in
them it seems like the hacks and cloak
gets more joy out of the space left than
space filled which isn't necessarily a
bad thing in and of itself certainly it
helps along with the very potent and
amazing vibe that is conjured on this
album but it does keep some of these
tracks from being engaging throughout on
the flipside of this complaint there are
some songs on here most notably the ones
around the three-minute mark that just
feel too short half-baked kind of
underdeveloped like they could have gone
on longer or evolved into something else
still these problems only reflect a
minority of tracks on this album as is
this album is incredible when it comes
to sound play and just pulling a very
very strong emotional reaction from me
there are moments where I do wish the
sonic palette was a little wider and
that the accent cloak found different
sounds and different textures to sort of
bring more variety and that the
structures and the rhythms behind these
tracks weren't quite so basic but man is
this album like an experience I'm
feeling a strong 7 to a light 8 on this
LP if you've given it a listen what do
you think of it do you love it
hate it why what do you think I should
review next and that's it the haxon
cloak excavation forever
[Music]
[Music]
